value: Hatra remains one of the most dangerous cities on Earth and is emphatically
a tourist destination. Those who are travelling here on business are strongly advised to consult their own government first and have an armed guard with them. Otherwise do not even

Hatra is an ancient city, founded by Arab tribes in the 3rd century BCE. It later became a part of the Parthian Empire, in which it flourished as a centre of trade and religion.
The ruins are plentiful, and many buildings and columns still stand to this day. It is one of the greatest examples of an ancient Parthian city.

Though I have not been there since the early 1980s, you would still have some success finding small artifacts on the ground in the less travelled parts of the city. Look for coins, small statues, spear heads and carved granite throwing stones (size of tennis balls). You can also see evidence of underground  services (water / sewerage) systems. Photo opportunities are vast.
